title: Ticket #5478: [EC2] Support longer identifiers.
description:
Tony Tiradani forwarded a notice received by Steve Timm from AWS: 

AWS is transitioning instance IDs and reservation IDs to a longer
format. The old format is a resource identifier followed by an
8-character string, and the new format is a resource identifier followed
by a 17-character string. You have until December 2016 to opt in to the
longer format.

If you do not take any action, you will be opted in automatically on
December 2016, when all new instance IDs and Reservation IDs will be
created with the longer format. Until the deadline, you can opt in and
out of the new format as needed. Only newly created resources receive
longer IDs; existing resources are unaffected.

Manage your transition to longer instance IDs and reservation IDs with
Resource ID length management
<https://us-west-2.console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/v2/home?region=us-west-2#IdFormatSettings:>,
and read more about the new format <https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/faqs/#longer-ids>.

According to the above FAQ, we can turn long IDs off and back on again on a per-IAM user basis, so testing should be easy. I don't anticipate any problems, except perhaps with the 'condor_q -grid' pretty-printer.

Deadline is from the FAQ and is when the shorter IDs will no longer be available.
remarks:
2016-Sep-09 13:54:26 by tlmiller: 
> except perhaps with the 'condor_q -grid' pretty-printer.

Sure enough, the longer instance IDs don't fit in the assigned column, and it's not easy to tell that they've been truncated. Everything else seems to be working, though.

2017-Jun-19 11:25:58 by tlmiller:
After talking with TJ and Jaime, we'll be leaving the -grid format alone* and adding -grid:ec2 instead.

* In our infinite spare time, we should have condor_q select the output format based on the grid resource (after grouping jobs by that, so that we print the fewest possible headers).
